Description: Jackson National Live Insurance agreed to pay $484,000 to reimburse its clients who allegedly had funds stolen by one of its agents.
Jackson National Life agreed to pay $2.5 million to settle multistate litigation regarding its use of the Social Security Administration's Death Master File.
Info Source: Multimillion Dollar Death Master Settlements Reached, States News Service, December 17, 2015 (via Nexis).

Description: Jackson National Life Insurance Company, Jackson National Life Distributors, LLC, and Jackson National Life Insurance Company of New York agreed to pay $20,500,000 to 21 complainants and furnish other relief to settle a race, national origin, and sex discrimination and retaliation lawsuit brought by the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission.

Info Source: Jackson National Life Agrees to Pay Nearly $483,000 to Connecticut Consumers, Bestwire, November 11, 2008 (via Nexis).

Notes: Link is to summary of Order, suspended or shared liability for penalties not available.
Link is to summary of Order, suspended or shared liability for penalties not available.

Description: Jackson National Life Insurance Co. and Jackson National Life Insurance Co. of NY agreed to pay $1,250,000 to the state as part of a settlement of allegations they had inadequate procedures to ensure policies and other funds were timely investigated and paid out to beneficiaries.
Fine levied for mistakenly using an insurance form in an incorrect manner. RCW 48.18.100
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Company fined for failing to use the correct company name on correspondence, fax forms, claim forms, and payments, and by using a non-compliant fraud warning on its forms, the Company violated RCW 48.05.190, WAC 284-30-670(2), RCW 48.30.010, and RCW 48.135.080.
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Fine levied for issuing forms that were not approved by the Commissioner; recommending an annuity transaction without having reasonable grounds for believing that the transaction is suitable for the consumer; failing to make reasonable efforts to determine the suitability information of a consumer. ...
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Company: Life Insurance Company of Georgia and Southland Life Insurance Company
Description: The companies agreed to pay $4 million to resolve multistate allegations that they had charged higher premiums to non-white customers for certain kinds of life insurance policies.

Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
